Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis

Class GeoKruskal<V extends GeoPoint,X extends Comparable<X> & Sequenced>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis.MST<V,X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis.Kruskal<V,X>
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.graphs.gis.GeoKruskal<V,X>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of vertices in the graph, extending GeoPoint.
X - the type of edge attributes, extending Comparable and implementing Sequenced.
All Implemented Interfaces:
GeoMST<V,X>, Iterable<Edge<V,X>>
public class GeoKruskal<V extends GeoPoint,X extends Comparable<X> & Sequenced> extends Kruskal<V,X> implements GeoMST<V,X>
The GeoKruskal class extends the Kruskal algorithm to work with geo-referenced graphs. This class specializes Kruskal's algorithm for generating a minimum spanning tree (MST) and outputs the results in a format compatible with geographical data representations.

The generic type parameters specify the types for vertices and edge attributes: - V extends GeoPoint: Vertices are defined as GeoPoint objects, which represent geographical locations with name and position information. - X extends Comparable invalid input: '&' Sequenced: Edge attributes must implement Comparable for weight comparison and Sequenced for maintaining a sequence order.

This class operates on graphs provided by the EdgeGraph interface.

  • Constructor Details

    • GeoKruskal

      public GeoKruskal(EdgeGraph<V,X> graph)
      Constructs a GeoKruskal instance for finding the minimum spanning tree (MST) of the given geo-referenced graph. This constructor initializes the base Kruskal algorithm with the provided EdgeGraph, which represents a structure of vertices and edges with geographical context.
      Parameters:
      graph - the edge-weighted geographic graph for which the MST is to be calculated. It must provide access to vertices and edges via methods defined in the EdgeGraph interface.

  • Method Details

    • getGeoMST

      public Geo<V,X> getGeoMST(Geo<V,X> geoGraph)
      Method to generate a graph of the MST, given an empty BaseGeoGraph
      Specified by:
      getGeoMST in interface GeoMST<V extends GeoPoint,X extends Comparable<X> & Sequenced>
      Parameters:
      geoGraph - an empty GeoGraph which will be filled with edges before being returned.
      Returns:
      the geoGraph that was passed as the parameter, but filled with the MST edges.

    • createEdge

      public Edge<V,X> createEdge(Edge<V,X> edge)
      Creates a new GeoEdge instance based on the provided edge.
      Parameters:
      edge - the input edge containing two vertices and an attribute. The vertices represent geographic points (of type V), and the attribute (of type X) specifies properties of the connection between the two vertices.
      Returns:
      a new GeoEdge instance that connects the same vertices as the input edge and carries the same attribute.
